WRITING.TEXT: Playing through the campaign was a little Hollywood, but overall pretty fun. A little short for my liking, but fun never the less. Now what I was hoping for were two campaigns allies and central powers. This war was the first of it kind with casualties being upwards of 6000 men/day. The only aggressors were the politicians and monarchs, the soldiers were the victims. I just find it a little bit of a let down to have the campaign to come down to a "good guys vs bad guys" story. There were so many stories from the trenches of both sides appealing to human decency. The novel All Quiet on the Western Front really paints a picture that the German soldiers were not these demonized Raiders the propaganda made them out to be but rather young men who were trying to serve their country like the allies. Maybe I'm seeing too far into the game than I should. What are your guy's thoughts?

But as I'm sure they didn't imagine to feed a whole army at the begining of a 10 year long winter so Dany might not be able to gather aid in the name of resources from them. As its been said in the first book by Jorah, all the king would have to do is close the gates and wait for the Dothraki to starve as they have no siege weapons. Okay so 424 hasn't had work for a while and the list is rather large. I'd hold off on union membership for maybe another few months. In regards to travel, another local has to call out to work for other locals before you can work in their jurisdiction. So say there is a big call out in Washington, the first people at the top of the list would get first pick and then they'd have to apply for work visas and such. The process could take a long time and by the time the call the job could be over sort of thing. So if your local can't find work for you they may allow you to 'salt', which is work non union in the attempts to organize or promote the ibew in a positive Manor. But you can only salt within your jurisdiction with your own local's support. If you cross union borders, you have to get permission from your local and the local your working in to work non union. Dues in my local are $42/mo for non working (you have to pay them no matter what) and working dues are like $78 or something per paycheque. But you only pay them when working. I'm not sure how 424 does their dues but I'm sure it's similar. I won't say my local but It's near 424 and I haven't had work in 2 years and I've been paying dues for little to no benefit with a lot of headache towards salting. I have seen guys get name requested job to job with no break while the rest of us have been going in debt. I'm concidering leaving the hall if work doesn't pick up even though I beleive the union is a good thing. It's up to you whether you join now or later but if I were you I'd probably just join when the economy is a little better.

Exactly what proud northerner said. I've been paying dues and salting in the mean time. But it's come time where the hall hasn't done enough to secure work and they've increased dues. When there was a ton ofor work two years ago it was great. High wages, pension, rssp, steady work. Im kind of holding on for the good ol days again but I'm kind of skeptical at this point.
